definition: murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
reeds/rushes
surname Mao
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
strategic pass/tactical border position
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Just read Leeao's book " The True Face of Chen Shui Bian" you will be enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 不妨讀讀李敖的《陳水扁真面目》，你將會茅塞頓開。

sentences.english: It occurred to me that this little creature might have some thoughts on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 頓時覺得，似乎這個小東西會令我茅塞頓開。

sentences.english: Kuester said that it was this humorous response made by the priest that inspired him.
sentences.chinese: 西勒庫斯特說，正是牧師的這一幽默，讓他茅塞頓開。

sentences.english: Seek the blessings and guidance of a higher authority and they might just show you the right path.
sentences.chinese: 向長輩尋求開導和指引吧，或許你能茅塞頓開。

sentences.english: The chart is below, and it's both an eye-opener and a spine-tingler.
sentences.chinese: 以下是比較圖表，讓人既茅塞頓開，也脊背發涼。

sentences.english: If I can, I really want to be a good person.
sentences.chinese: 希望某天茅塞頓開這種事也能發生在我身上。

sentences.english: It will definitely get people to do a double take. What do you guys think?
sentences.chinese: 它完全讓人茅塞頓開，你覺得呢？

definition: lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
magnanimous
calm/unruffled
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to be secretly delighted
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
courage/bravery
to provide food for thought (idiom)/thought-provoking
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
